title: The Sensorites
dialogue_triumphs: Maitland: 'Did you know, his hair was almost white?' Doctor: 'Nothing wrong with that!'
dialogue_disasters: I have never thought of that!
goofs: In episode one, as the Doctor ponders 'or to kill us?' the camera hits the desk in front of him.
Maitland's drill marks are visible before he cuts them.
In episode two, the Sensorites stand on each other's feet.
Sound carries in space [the Sensorites send it deliberately].
According to the Doctor, the shoulder flash they find in episode six says INNER, but it actually says INEER.

continuity_notes.name: Sensorites
continuity_notes.description: Alien race with telepathic abilities and sensitivity to loud noises and darkness. They have a caste system and can control spaceships and human brains.
continuity_notes.current_status: Interacting with the TARDIS crew and Earth astronauts

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, shown to have knowledge of poisoning and ability to fly a spaceship. Reveals he has only one heart at this point.

continuity_notes.name: Susan
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's granddaughter, revealed to be a few years younger than Carol. Has advanced telepathic abilities.
continuity_notes.current_status: Assisting the Doctor and demonstrating her telepathic skills

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: Time and space travel device with a complex locking mechanism
continuity_notes.current_status: Parked on Sensesphere, with details about its lock mechanism revealed

technobabble: The Sensorites' hand-rays burn, cut, activate photoelectric cells, stun, and paralyse for an hour at a range of 30 yards.
The TARDIS lock has a metabolism detector.
links: The TARDIS crew discuss their adventures so far (but miss out 'The Edge of Destruction').

locations.name: Sensesphere
locations.description: Home planet of the Sensorites, with slightly larger landmass than usual. Features include Yellow Mountains and outer wastes of the desert.
locations.current_status: Setting for the majority of the story

locations.name: Earth spacecraft
locations.description: 28th century Earth vessel where the TARDIS crew first encounters the situation

future_history: The story is set in the 28th century. Earth has too much air traffic, and the lower half of England is known as Central City. Big Ben has been destroyed, and London hasn't existed for 400 years. Space exploration and mining rights on other planets are important.
untold_adventures: The Doctor deliberately quarrelled with Henry VIII and was sent to the Tower of London.
The Doctor and Susan encountered telepathic plants on the planet Esto.
additional_notes: The story features detailed information about the TARDIS lock mechanism and its evolution throughout the series.
bottom_line: It veers from sinister to unintentionally hilarious, with everyone fluffing their lines. The presence of Peter Glaze's familiar body language leads one to expect Don MacLean to burst onto set, tripping over his circular feet.
